bio: Lead artist for ACiD in the early 90s, known for detailed fantasy scenes and expressive typography.
Worked for both major groups; pioneered the multi-group style that defined mid-90s BBS art.
iCE's signature sci-fi and cyberpunk artist, credited with defining the iCE aesthetic.
Fire Art member known for large fantasy compositions and detailed character work.
Core Mistigris member, organizer, and prolific ASCII/ANSI artist.
Blocktronics co-founder, modern ANSI artist continuing the classic aesthetic with contemporary themes.
Early ACiD member, credited with some of the most intricate logo designs of the era.
Multi-era artist bridging the classic and modern scenes, known for bold color choices.
ACiD member known for moody, atmospheric ANSI pieces.
ACiD artist contributing large-scale scroll pieces to the Acquisition series.
Designer of the FILE_ID.DIZ artwork for the April 1994 Acquisition.
ACiD artist known for energetic, high-contrast ANSI work.
ACiD artist known for evocative dream-themed work.
One of ACiD's most prolific members during the 1993–94 peak period.
ACiD member responsible for several landmark pieces including Electric Acid.
Prolific ACiD artist, notable for the sprawling Castle of Darkness (154KB).
ACiD member who produced the Distorted Magazine EXE.
ACiD co-founder and creator of the IBM VGA character font used in many packs. Co-inventor of SAUCE with Tasmaniac.
ACiD member with a distinctive, bold ANSI style.
ACiD artist known for moodily lit ANSI compositions.
Released the SPOON.EXE SAUCE-tagging utility alongside the April 1994 Acquisition.
ACiD artist and magazine producer — released Insomnia and Psychosis e-zines.
ACiD member whose Death Row piece became one of the most downloaded of the era.
ACiD co-founder and modem-simulation engineer. Co-invented SAUCE with RaD Man.
ACiD RIP specialist, contributing several RIP screen files to the Acquisition.
ACiD artist focused on network and BBS-themed logo work.
ACiD coder who built ACiD View; co-authored its documentation with RaD Man.
